result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:14 PM Defendant TWILA M SHAWANO in court.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD services but is awaiting appointment.

Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

plus $1,000.00 signature bond
Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments including liquor stores, No contact with known drug users or dealers. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

+ $1,000 signature bond.
Pictures & prints.  Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments, including liquor stores. No contact with known drug users or dealers. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

1:14 PM Defendant TWILA M SHAWANO appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Joe Furnstahl appears for bond purposes ONLY.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender services.  State requests $500.00 cash bond with conditions.  Response by Atty. Furnstahl. Court makes its findings and sets a $250.00 cash + $1,000 signature bond with conditions.  Defendant will be hiring her own counsel.  Court advises party of her right to have a preliminary hearing within 20 days or wait to have counsel.  Defendant wishes to waive the time limiits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
